command.name: add

parameter.name: end-point
parameter.description: the IP address of the tunnel end-point

command.abstract: add a tunnel on one node

description.p: This command adds a tunnel from one node towards the tunnel end-point. The tunnel end-point should be another existing node (though C-BGP will not perform any verification). Messages that will be routed through this tunnel will be encapsulated in a packet whose destination is the end-point address. Such packets will therefore be forwarded to the end-point and decapsulated there. See also the net node ipip-enablenet_node_ipip-enable command to enable the decapsulation of IP-in-IP paquets at the tunnel end-point.
IMPORTANT NOTE: due to changes in the network topology data structure, the tunneling feature is currently broken.
